name: 24/7 Emergency Electrical Service
description: When electrical emergencies strike, every second counts. Solomon Electric provides around-the-clock emergency electrical services throughout South Florida—available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, 365 days a year. Our licensed electricians respond quickly to power outages, dangerous sparking, burning smells, circuit failures, and any critical electrical situation that threatens your family's safety or disrupts your business operations.

warningSignsHeading: Electrical Emergencies That Require Immediate Attention
warningSignsSubheading: Some electrical problems can't wait until tomorrow. If you're experiencing any of these situations, call us immediately—your safety depends on it.

problems.title: Burning Smell from Outlets or Panels
problems.description: A burning odor indicates overheating wires or components that could ignite at any moment. This is a fire hazard requiring immediate professional attention.

problems.title: Sparking or Arcing from Outlets
problems.description: Visible sparks when plugging in devices or sparks coming from outlets signal dangerous wiring faults that can cause electrical fires or severe shock.

problems.title: Complete Power Loss to Your Home
problems.description: If your home has no power but neighbors do, you may have a failed main breaker, damaged service entrance, or utility connection issue requiring expert diagnosis.

problems.title: Buzzing or Humming from Electrical Panel
problems.description: Unusual sounds from your breaker panel indicate loose connections, failing breakers, or dangerous arcing that could lead to fire.

problems.title: Outlets or Switches That Are Hot to Touch
problems.description: Warm or hot electrical components indicate overloaded circuits or poor connections that are actively creating fire risk inside your walls.

problems.title: Electrical Shock When Touching Appliances
problems.description: Receiving a shock—even a mild tingle—from appliances or fixtures indicates dangerous grounding problems that could cause serious injury or death.

process.title: Immediate Phone Assessment

process.title: Rapid Dispatch

process.title: On-Site Diagnosis

process.title: Upfront Pricing Approval

process.title: Professional Repair & Safety Verification

faqs.question: What qualifies as an electrical emergency?
faqs.answer: Any situation that poses immediate risk to safety or property qualifies as an emergency: burning smells from electrical components, sparking outlets, complete power loss, exposed wires, electrical shocks, buzzing panels, or any situation where you fear a fire could start. When in doubt, call us—we'd rather assess a non-emergency than have you wait during a dangerous situation.

faqs.question: How quickly can an electrician arrive at my home?
faqs.answer: Response times depend on current call volume and your location, but we prioritize true emergencies. For fire hazards, sparking, or electrical shocks, we dispatch immediately. Our service area covers all of Miami-Dade and Broward counties, with electricians strategically positioned throughout the region.

faqs.question: Do you charge more for nights, weekends, or holidays?
faqs.answer: We offer transparent, competitive emergency rates. While emergency calls naturally require premium availability, we don't exploit crisis situations with excessive markups. You'll receive upfront pricing before any work begins—no surprises on your bill.

faqs.question: Should I turn off my power before you arrive?
faqs.answer: If you smell burning, see sparking, or feel the situation is immediately dangerous, go to your main breaker and switch it OFF. This eliminates power to your home and stops most electrical hazards. If you're unsure where your main breaker is or feel unsafe approaching your panel, leave the home and call us immediately.

faqs.question: What if the repair needs parts you don't have?
faqs.answer: Our service vehicles carry the most common replacement parts—breakers, outlets, wiring, connectors, and safety devices. For unusual equipment or specialized repairs, we'll secure the area, provide a temporary safe solution if possible, and return promptly with the required materials.

faqs.question: Do you handle commercial and business emergencies?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. We serve residential, commercial, and industrial properties. Business electrical emergencies—especially those affecting operations, safety systems, or refrigeration—receive priority response. We understand that downtime costs money.

faqs.question: What areas do you serve for emergency calls?
faqs.answer: We provide emergency electrical service throughout Miami-Dade County (Miami, Miami Beach, Coral Gables, Hialeah, Kendall) and Broward County (Fort Lauderdale, Hollywood, Pembroke Pines, Coral Springs, Deerfield Beach). Call us even if you're unsure—we'll let you know if we can help.

faqs.question: Can I wait until morning if the problem seems minor?
faqs.answer: If there's no burning smell, sparking, shock hazard, or heat coming from electrical components, many issues can safely wait. However, if you're losing sleep worrying about it, that's often your instinct telling you something is wrong. Trust your gut—the peace of mind from a professional assessment is worth it.

seoContent.heading: Emergency Electrician Services in Miami & South Florida
seoContent.body: Electrical emergencies don't wait for convenient hours—and neither do we. Solomon Electric provides professional 24/7 emergency electrical service to homeowners and businesses throughout Miami-Dade and Broward counties. When you smell burning, see sparks, or lose power unexpectedly, you need a licensed electrician who can respond immediately, diagnose the problem accurately, and restore safety to your property.

seoContent.heading: Common Electrical Emergencies We Handle
seoContent.body: Our emergency electricians regularly respond to power outages, circuit breaker failures, sparking or arcing outlets, burning smells from panels or walls, electrical shocks from fixtures, storm damage to electrical systems, and any situation where electrical problems create immediate safety concerns. We arrive with fully-stocked vehicles capable of handling most repairs on the first visit.

seoContent.heading: South Florida's Trusted Emergency Electrical Response
seoContent.body: With over 15 years serving South Florida, Solomon Electric has built a reputation for reliable emergency response. Our Florida State Licensed electricians (License #EC13012419) are available 24 hours a day, equipped to handle everything from simple breaker resets to complex wiring failures. We serve Miami, Fort Lauderdale, Hollywood, Coral Gables, Pembroke Pines, and all surrounding communities.

seoContent.heading: What to Do During an Electrical Emergency
seoContent.body: Your safety comes first. If you smell burning or see flames, evacuate and call 911. For non-fire emergencies, locate your main breaker panel and switch it OFF to cut power. Don't attempt to repair electrical problems yourself—even seemingly simple issues can cause shock or fire. Call Solomon Electric and we'll guide you through keeping safe until our electrician arrives.
